adjective.description: Relating to or characterized by musical harmony.
Using or produced by the application of a harmonic.

noun.description: An overtone accompanying a fundamental tone at a fixed interval, produced by vibration of a string, column of air, etc. in an exact fraction of its length.
A component frequency of an oscillation or wave.
A division of the zodiacal circle by a specified number, used in the interpretation of a birth chart.

origin: Late 16th century (in the sense relating to music, musical): via Latin from Greek harmonikos, from harmonia (see harmony).
